section.name: PSTH
section.definition: An Analysis-type section to describe an PSTH.

property.name: Author
property.definition: The name of the person who did the analysis, e.g. 'John Doe' or 'Doe, John'

property.name: Description
property.definition: A general description of the analysis.

property.name: Method
property.value: [instantaneous spike rate, sliding window, discrete window]
property.definition: The method used for creating the PSTH. instantaneous spike rate; Estimation of the firing rate by using the inverse of the interspike interval.; sliding window: The window function was slid over the data at recording resolution.; discrete window: Spikes were averaged within the window, window discretely displaced by the window width.

property.name: WindowType
property.definition: The kind of windowing function used to cerate the PSTH.

property.name: CommandlineCall
property.definition: The command used to execute the analysis including the command line parameter.

property.name: CodeFile
property.definition: The URL of the applied piece of program code to actually do the analysis.

property.name: CodeRevision
property.definition: If the analysis code is under version control the revision number can be specified using this property.

property.name: ConfigFile
property.definition: The URL to the configuration file used to run the analysis.

property.name: DatasetFile
property.definition: The URL to the dataset file the analysis is applied on.

property.name: ResultFile
property.definition: The URL to the results file the analysis was applied on.

property.name: ResultFigure
property.definition: The URL to a figure file showing the results of the analysis.

property.name: PaperDOI
property.definition: If the results of this analysis have been published one can store the doi of the paper.

property.name: PaperURL
property.definition: If the results of this analysis have been published the URL of the document can be given here
